{"ratings": {"overall": 1.0}, "title": "\u201cRoach Motel!\u201d", "text": "I chose the Beacon Hotel after days of researching where to stay in New York City for my one night personal extension from a business trip in December 2004. Not only did the reviews from this site give it a thumb's up, but also various travel publications as well. \nI will say the location of the property is very good, with it's walking distance to the subway and to Central Park. The lobby is also presentable, but small. The problem I had was as soon as I got off the elevator, the halls were musty, ugly and very run down. I knew I was not in for a treat when I got to my assigned room. When arriving outside the door to the room, the door handle was broken and therefore, the key did not work. Not a good sign. Having to go back to the front desk for another room assignment, I was given a new room on the same floor - oh joy!\nUpon entering the room, it was what I expected after seeing the condition of the hallway. The room was rundown and dowdy. The size of the room was adequate, but the bathroom was small. Some may rate this hotel with high marks due to the kitchenette in every room. I learned a lesson that in the future I will never stay in rooms with kitchenettes due to what kind of \"visitors\" it attracts.\nAfter spending one sleepless night, I woke in the morning only to find roaches in the room and bathroom. They were on the table, the chair, the bathroom floor and sink! I totally freaked out that they were in my opened luggage. After a quick exit, I got out of that room as soon as I could as I was totally disgusted!\nNeeding a ride to LaGuardia airport, I asked the concierge for assistance. They were too busy helping others obtain rides that they contracted and told me my best bet was catching a cab. {"ratings": {"overall": 4.0}, "title": "\u201cAbsoultely Fine\u201d", "text": "My wife and I and 11 year old daughter were lucky enough to get a room for the Wednesday before Thangiving Day Parade (2004). This hotel is absolutely fine and we recommend it, especially for its value and location. Somone said it was a little dated and perhaps so, but it was not run down by any means, not at all. Everything was clean. Plus the rooms have a refrigerator and microwave which is a teriffic advantage, especially for leftovers. And the rooms may be a bit larger than most other hotels in their class because they are converted apartments, I believe. (So, maybe not so dated after all). The location is excellent. For the parade, just a few blocks away from Central Park West (but get on the parade route by 6 AM to stake out your spot) and the Upper West Side is a great location, for walking, eating (and grazing). And you don't have to spend a fortune to eat in NYC. For example, there are several \"upper crust\" places for breakfast, brunch, etc.in the general neighborhood, such as Sarabeth's and Good Enough to Eat. But, also nearby (on 78th and Amsterdam) is a \"diner\" called Shining Star. We just had breakfast food and is was excellent on all accounts. Pancakes for $3.95--you can't beat that anywhere in the USA much less the Upper West Side. And they are open 24 hours, a full fledged diner. Plus. it may not be as \"fashionable\" as some of their neighbors, but it's still a place where neighborhood folks go, so you get plenty of NYC flavor too. Don't overlook this place. Also for cheap eats in the surrounding area: Fairway supermarket (and Cittarella's) are just across the street, an excellent Greek/Meditteranean place (Nikos is a few blocks away, and Zabar's (a NYC institution) at 80th and Broadway, both the corner cafe and the supermarket, with excellent appetizing counter and also prepared foods to go, fairly priced. And for great pastry try Le Pain Quotidien at 76th and Amsterdam, or 72nd and Columbus and, fantastic bakery at 90th and Broadway (Georgine's ???). As an alternative to Beacon Hotel, check out The Lucerne at 79th and Amsterdam (I posted a review there too). Both are excellent choices and values. Beacon rooms are a bit bigger and have the advantage of a refrigerator and microwave; Lucerne may be perceived as a \"step up\" in some guidebooks, but maybe only a fraction of a step (but no fridge). You'll do fine at either. Final note re. Beacon--I left my cell phone charger there. I called up, they located it and sent it back to me by Fed Ex--at no cost to me. That was nice and is representative of their hospitality.", "author": {"username": "mkatrack", "num_cities": 36, "num_helpful_votes": 193, "num_reviews": 52, "num_type_reviews": 21, "id": "BD4FDAC692918F7932DCAFD0C192BBE6", "location": "Albany, NY"}, "offering_id": 93338, "num_helpful_votes": 23, "date": "January 30, 2005", "id": 3099050, "via_mobile": false}

{"ratings": {"overall": 5.0}, "title": "\u201cHotel Beacon - Fulfilled Expectations!\u201d", "text": "Reading TripAdvisor comments before booking our hotel reservations provided very good insight on the establishment. However a few of the negative comments adds a question mark that stays in the back of your mind. As we were arriving at the hotel, I was a little apprehensive. But as we entered the small but very nice lobby area, any doubt left my mind. The lobby area looked like it had been renovated and was nice and clean. The 3 elevators were small and rustic, but expected from an older building. The hotel rooms were as described by most of the other TripAdvisor comments: suites were large with full kitchenette, two large TV's, temperature control AC, cable channels, etc. The only negative thing about the room is that the carpet should be changed - it was worn out. The restaurant (Viand) located next door to the hotel lobby entrance had a comprehensive menu and good food, and was very faily priced considering it is quasi connected to the hotel.\nThe hotel is conveniently located just 1 short block from the subway, which is not hard to navigate if you study the subway maps and map out your journey beforehand (if Hawaii people can use the subway, anyone can). The neighborhood is very comfortable with a lot of good restaurants, two gourmet type grocery stores and other specialty stores within walking distance. We felt pretty safe walking the streets at night and riding the subways.\nOur excellent rating is not because the Hotel Beacon is a four star hotel but based on the price, location, neighborhood and accomodations, it was excellent experience. A couple blocks from Central Park, an easy walk to the Natural History Museum and only a couple blocks from a children's museum. \nWil most definitely stay at the Beacon again!!!!! {"ratings": {"overall": 4.0}, "title": "\u201cGreat for the budget traveler\u201d", "text": "I typically frequent hostels, since I travel alone and have a limited budget. This time, I decided to upgrade, and I wasn't disappointed. Definitely not a first-class hotel, but if you're looking for a comfortable room in a great location, then the Beacon is perfect. Affordably priced with all the right accomodations. The kitchenette was great to have! Plenty of room, the A/C never failed, and the bathrooms are very clean. Furnishings were worn, but acceptable. The windows seemed thin--they were closed during my stay, yet I could still hear plenty of street noise. Fun location, although the subway was a little far for me in 90% humidity. It's not right around the corner, but if the heat and a little legwork doesn't bother you, it's plenty close enough. Great places to eat and shop nearby, and seemed quite safe. Whenever I'm looking to save, I will definitely return!", "author": {"username": "", "id": "", "location": ""}, "offering_id": 93338, "num_helpful_votes": 3, "date": "June 22, 2004", "id": 2215556, "via_mobile": false}

{"ratings": {"overall": 4.0}, "title": "\u201cNot bad\u201d", "text": "WHEN: Stayed May 7-12. Two adults.\nROOM: Guestroom with double beds and kitchenette\nFIRST IMPRESSION: Room isn't your upscale type of hotel room but it isn't your Motel 6 either. It definitely is bigger than your budget NYC hotel room. Good size for the price. Didn't have a view but faced the sidestreet; didn't have any noise from the street like I've read. We slept well through the nights. Perhaps the rooms facing Broadway Avenue may have had more noise? The carpet looked a bit dingy. The beds were comfortable; firm. Small table with two chairs provided. Dresser with two larger drawers. TV with cable. Shades that you could roll up or down by simply pulling on a cord. AC worked well. Alarm clock available. Iron and board in small closet.\nKITCHENETTE: Microwave, electric stove, and small refrigerator. You also are provided with plates and utensils for four people. We made ourselves breakfast burritos each morning! In addition there is a nonstick pan, a couple of serving utensils, and a toaster! \nBATHROOM: Very small. Bathtub/shower combo. Not too much counterspace. Toilet with strong flush.\nSTAFF: Not overly friendly but then we're not ones to ask for a lot and complain.\nLOCATION: Upper West Side\nHOTEL BEACON NEIGHBORS: Fairway Market is right across the street and closes at 130am. You can get fruit, eggs, various meat, etc. If you're more interested in gourmet type groceries then you can head uptown to Zabar's which is about 7 blocks away (80th Street). Starbucks is practically next door on the right. Vivaldi cafe is literally next to the entrance. \nTRANSPORTATION: **SUBWAY**About a block and half from the subway, 2 minute walk; 72nd Street stop to be exact. Jump on the Red 1, 2, 3, or 9 line and that'll take you straight to Battery Park (South Ferry stop) if you go downtown with various stops such as Times Square and Columbus Circle (Central Park). **TAXI**Easy to hail a cab as soon as you step out on the sidewalk. \nRENOVATION: They are currently having some work done to update their really small lobby. Should be complete by midsummer. Noise is not bothersome. We were out all day and only really just pass through the lobby so the work being done was not a nuisance. They do have fairly quick elevators (3). \n**All in all, we would consider staying here again on our next visit although we would also consider trying out another more upscale hotel such as the Marriott or Sheraton just to see what a regular hotel room in this type of hotel would be like. But only if the price is right. Hope this helped. Post any questions as I regularly review this site.", "author": {"username": "jzen717", "num_cities": 2, "num_helpful_votes": 23, "num_reviews": 2, "location": "California, United States", "id": "8748804BDDAF3A5D3D6D2AE4C844E93B"}, "offering_id": 93338, "num_helpful_votes": 15, "date": "May 15, 2004", "id": 2061358, "via_mobile": false}

It was very handy to have fridge and microwave for restaurant leftovers. The stove burners shorted out at times, but worked well enough for our purposes. No view, but they offered to move us to a view room when it came available next day. The room was very clean and quiet except during concerts at the Beacon Theater directly underneath us.\nThe price was 1/3 less than a kitchenette suite in the Doubletree Times Square, with a much nicer neighborhood and ambience. Friendly concierge, outstanding location with museums, shops, Central Park, and cafes in walking distance. The rest of New York easily reached by subway. {"ratings": {"overall": 4.0}, "title": "\u201cExcellent hotel & wheelchair access!\u201d", "text": "This hotel is a true find, especially for wheelchair users and disabled travelers. Upon arrival, a separate entrance then a ramp lead you to the front desk. The staff is courteous and thoughtful.The room we had was a one bedroom suite, and it was hands-down the most wheelchair accessible hotel room we've ever stayed in.The bathroom featured marble floors and roll-in shower, a bath chair is available in the hall closet. The kitchenette was obviously recently renovated with marble floors, brand-new cabinets, full-sized fridge, as well as a microwave, coffee maker and mini-stove. Pots, pans, plates and silverware are all there. Just pick up some groceries and you're good to go for days. The kitchen and bathroom sinks are open underneath, no problem if you use a wheelchair.The nicely appointed living room featured a pull-out couch, kitchenette table, comfy chairs and coffee and end tables. The bedroom was more than adequately-sized, featuring a closet with lowered hanging area. Comfy pillows and soft blankets made for a restful night after touring Manhattan.All doors in the \"apartment\" (I call it that because it was bigger than some of our NY relatives' pads!) are extra-wide. The window shades are easily lowered and raised with a reachable pulley chain.Need anything? The concierge is helpful and at the ready. A gem on Broadway, the Hotel Beacon will be our home away from home when visiting Manhattan. Thanks to the staff and management for a wonderful stay.", "author": {"username": "", "id": "", "location": ""}, "offering_id": 93338, "num_helpful_votes": 8, "date": "April 29, 2004", "id": 1848290, "via_mobile": false}

{"ratings": {"overall": 5.0}, "title": "\u201cA real gem in a lively neighborhood! A wonderful stay.\u201d", "text": "My wife and I just returned from a six night stay at The Beacon along with our two young boys as a special treat over their spring break from grade school. I'm pleased to report that it suited our needs very well. We selected this hotel on the strength of the many positive reviews we read on this website, and the favorable press is well-justified. The location is 75th and Broadway, and there are many amenities within the immediate area of the hotel: Grocery stores, pubs/bars, upscale eateries, family diners, budget fast food, drug and department stores--you name it. There are two subway stations within a short walk in opposite directions of the hotel, and you can get anywhere in Manhattan from there. The closet space is excellent, and the hotel, while not particuarly lavish, is certainly clean and well-managed. A minor negative is that we did hear some street noise even though we were on the 22nd floor, but then again that's pretty much par for the course in a city like NYC unless you're staying in some posh hotel. It wasn't so bad as to keep us awake, or anything of the sort. The simple fact is that this hotel a terrific choice for a family of four or less, particularly if young kids are in the picture. The kitchenette (complete with a stove and a good sized refrigerator/freezer) is a huge plus, and very hard to find in NYC hotels. We had breakfast in our room each morning, munching on all kinds of great stuff from the Fairway Market directly across the street. We wouldn't hesitate to stay at The Beacon again in the future. You could do MUCH worse.", "author": {"username": "Charger_Fanatic", "num_reviews": 1, "id": "4A61858CE7E04E040F5F2284C13CD98A", "location": "Downey, CA", "num_helpful_votes": 1}, "offering_id": 93338, "num_helpful_votes": 1, "date": "April 15, 2004", "id": 1785987, "via_mobile": false}

{"ratings": {"cleanliness": 5.0, "value": 5.0, "overall": 5.0, "rooms": 4.0, "service": 4.0}, "title": "\u201cGreat value for money!\u201d", "text": "My partner and I stayed at the Beacon between October 20th and October 27th 2003. It was my fourth and my partners first visit to NYC, and we were both extremely pleased with the location of the hotel. The residential neighborhood is friendly and lively with a great amount of stores and restaurants, and it felt very safe even late at night. As you enter the street you have both Fairway Market and Citarellas just across Broadway great places to fill up your reserves and a bit to the left you see the Ansonia building, one of the most magnificent buildings in the entire city. Next to the Beacon you find the Viand Caf\u00e9, open 24 hrs, where you may want to have your breakfast. The subway at 72nd St is just a couple of minutes walk away, Zabars is a five minute walk, and you have lots of restaurants just around the corner. (We highly recommend Papardellas at 76th and Columbus, and Bruculino at 225 Columbus Ave!)Our room was large and very clean and the bathroom was spacious. We were especially pleased with the in-room safe, big enough to fit cameras and other valuable belongings you didnt necessarily want to bring with you late at nights. The view from the 20th floor was great. We didnt see a lot of Central Park, but well some nice views of the Dakota and the San Remo buildings. The traffic in the streets could be heard through the windows, but we didnt think it was a problem.The staff at the Beacon were accommodating to us at all times. Everyone was friendly, from the manager to the cleaning staff.The only hesitation we had was that there seemed to be a small draft from the windows. On the other hand did the air conditioning efficiently solve that problem.Indeed, the Beacon isnt a luxury hotel, but it absolutely fulfilled our every need, and as the say on their home page, it is a place you want to come home to after a long days browsing the Manhattan neighborhoods. We will definitely recommend this hotel to any of our friends, and wed be happy to stay here again ourselves.", "author": {"username": "coolcat", "num_cities": 4, "num_helpful_votes": 24, "num_reviews": 7, "num_type_reviews": 6, "id": "94062A4E1B7CE60FB811455CC929D96C", "location": "malmo, sweden"}, "date_stayed": "October 2003", "offering_id": 93338, "num_helpful_votes": 17, "date": "October 31, 2003", "id": 1432328, "via_mobile": false}

I knew that my weekend would be free and I wanted to be closer to the culture of city. I really wanted to avoid the constant buzz and flash of Times Square, and the shuffling of money in the business and financial district. I finally chose the Hotel Beacon based on price and location. It's in a great location on the Upper West Side. They were offering a special on their one bedroom suites that I just couldn't pass up. It was well worth it because I had an excellent view of Central Park, a kitchen, and the rooms were quite large compared to most NYC hotels I have stayed in throughout the past. I had a one bedroom suite for only $180/nt and it had a kitchenette with all the dishes and everything I needed. I think the Beacon's regular rooms have kitchenettes too. I couldn't imagine being in a better location for what I needed. Just about everything I did while in the city I did it within a 10 block radius. I was right next to Lincoln Center, Museum of Natural History, Central Park, the Rose Center, and an abundance of food and entertainment for when the sun went down. The neighborhood felt very safe and the tree-lined streets were a very nice touch to top it off with. Overall, I couldnt imagine staying anywhere else in the city. However, my only complaint would be the lack of intrusive lights and sounds that used to interrupt my sleep before I found this place. I definitely expected to pay much more for such high ceilings, the marble bathroom, and all great staff. I booked this hotel on-line from the Hotel's web site after reading the reviews here at Trip Advisor and I was glad I did.The hotel staff was wonderful and very helpful. The room was clean and large with an average size very nice bathroom with a hair dryer. The room also had a small refrigerator, a microwave, a toaster, a coffee pot, and a 2-burner stove with pots and pans, plates, bowls, glasses, and silverware for four. For some reason there was not a spatula, so I don't know what you would do if you wanted to cook some eggs over-easy. Also, there is no ice available other than two small ice cube trays in the refrigerator. We did request two more trays that were brought up promptly. The Fairway (a very interesting grocery/deli store) was just across the street so we got some food for breakfasts and snacks. Zabars (another very interesting grocery/deli store) was about six blocks north.We were just a few short blocks from the subway which was very convenient. An Avis car rental location was just one block north. If you wanted a taxi generally it took a little longer to get one that was available around 9 a.m. One day we just gave up and walked the 11 blocks to where we wanted to go.Because we were in the upper West Side it was away from all the hustle and bustle of the Times Square area and other tourist areas. That was nice when it came time to go back to the hotel because it wasn't so crazy like other parts of the city and was very relaxing. En nuestro caso supero ampliamente nuestras expectativas, eramos 4 personas adultas en una suite, las camas comodisimas, el ba\u00f1o y los amenities impecables, todo lo que necesitabamos estaba a disposicion, la cocina es lo mas comodo ya que desayunabamos alli, tiene cafetera y te brindan todos los elementos para hacerlo, con solo comprar algo en el Fairway o en los locales de por ahi es suficiente, y para cenar igual, hay platos, cubiertos, o sea esta provisto de todo lo necesario, increible la limpieza, no podria objetarle nada a este hotel, la zona no podria ser mejor quizas en un comienzo se podria pensar q esta algo alejado pero esta en la zona justa, a dos cuadras esta la boca del subte q te lleva a todos lados, y sino caminando se puede hacer mucho tambien. Lo unico que podria quizas observar es que por la ma\u00f1ana no habia empleados del hotel que hablaran castellano, solo por la tarde habia una se\u00f1ora muy agradable, igual como en todos lados no fue un impedimento para hacernos entender. {"ratings": {"service": 4.0, "cleanliness": 5.0, "overall": 5.0, "value": 5.0, "rooms": 5.0, "location": 5.0}, "title": "\u201cExcellente adresse\u201d", "text": "Excellent hotel de tout point de vue, nous y retournerons sans aucun doute.\nAvantages : \n1) Situation. Quartier Upper West Side, \u00e0 deux blocs du central park. Ce quartier est \u00e9loign\u00e9 des buildings \u00e9touffants du Midtown newyorkais. Cela permet de voir comment vivent aussi les newyorkais : vous croiserez les habitants du quartier essentiellement. R\u00e9put\u00e9 \u00eatre le lieu des intellectuels, ce quartier a le charme des films de Woody Allen, c'est le quartier de \"Vous avez un message\" pour les cin\u00e9philes.\nL'h\u00f4tel est sur l'avenue Broadway, une infinit\u00e9 de magasins et services sont pr\u00e9sents sur cet axe : coiffeurs, restaurants, magasins (American Apparel, Banana Republic), tout pr\u00e8s des cin\u00e9mas de Lincoln Center, \u00e0 deux pas de la tr\u00e8s anim\u00e9e Columbus avenue et \u00e9galement de l'avenue Amsterdam. A deux blocs de Gray's Papaya les meilleurs hot-dogs de New York ! \nA deux blocs de la station de m\u00e9tro 72 qui dessert la ligne 1 du m\u00e9tro Bronx (vers le nord ou uptown) et South Ferry vers le sud (downtown).\nDans le secteur se trouve le Mus\u00e9e Am\u00e9ricain d'Histoire Naturelle (la nuit au mus\u00e9e), \u00e0 4 blocs.\nEn face, la banque TD permet de retirer de l'argent (distributeurs en libre service) et \u00e9galement de changer des devises (pr\u00e9sentation du passeport obligatoire pour changer de l'argent).\nSi vous regardez un plan de Manhattan, ne croyez pas que vous serez excentr\u00e9, au contraire, vous serez dans un quartier qui a sa propre vie, loin de la folie de Times Square o\u00f9 la foule de touristes s'y retrouve. Pour autant, si vous prenez un taxi pour aller \u00e0 Times Square vous aurez pour au plus 10 dollars, ou bien, prenez le m\u00e9tro \u00e0 deux pas de l'hotel. A pied, en 10-15 minutes vous \u00eates \u00e0 Columbus circle (50\u00e8 rue) zone tr\u00e8s commerciale (galeries, magasins), et si vous continuez par Broadway vous arrivez en 15 minutes de plus \u00e0 Times Square et ses fameux \u00e9crans.\n2\u00b0 Services : en face de l'hotel : FAIRWAY \"le\" supermarch\u00e9 de new york. Supermarch\u00e9 alimentaire vous trouverez absolument de tout : plats cuisin\u00e9s, fruits et l\u00e9gumes frais, d\u00e9licieux bagels, d\u00e9licieux fruits frais, ouvert de 6h \u00e0 minuit.\nAu rez-de-chauss\u00e9e, Viand Caf\u00e9, un typique diner de Manhattan, lieu propre, prix tr\u00e8s corrects (petit d\u00e9jeuners moyenne 10 dollars par personne pour des Pancakes avec oeufs, jambon, bacon, sirop d'\u00e9rable, mais il y a de tout !!). Service sympathique et serviable, toujours souriants, un vrai bonheur !\n3\u00b0 Qualit\u00e9 de l'hotel : immeuble r\u00e9nov\u00e9, toutes les chambres sont du m\u00eame style de mobilier sobre d\u00e9cor\u00e9 avec go\u00fbt. Personnel tr\u00e8s serviable parlant en tout cas espagnol, italien, un peu de fran\u00e7ais. Un service de renseignements touristiques sur place permet de r\u00e9server des activit\u00e9s (h\u00e9licopt\u00e8re, city-tours, tickets), des conseils avis\u00e9s et renseignements toujours avec le sourire. Un vrai souci de satisfaction client.\nConcernant la s\u00e9curit\u00e9, c'est parfait, toujours surveill\u00e9, portiers, concierge, front-desk, le portier asiatique ou bien ceux de la nuit (hispaniques) sont super serviables et vous trouvent des taxis et vous renseignent. \nVous disposez d'un coffre fort dans votre chambre.\nInconv\u00e9nient\nLe seul \"hic\" c'est que l'internet est payant 9,95 dollars par jour pour avoir le code Wi-fi pour connecter son ordinateur, mais la qualit\u00e9 de la liaison est excellente, tr\u00e8s haute vitesse. Quiz\u00e1 demasiado al norte del resto de atracciones de la ciudad, pero caminando tampoco se hace largo los primeros d\u00edas para explorar el \u00e1rea. El metro esta en la 72, a pocos pasos. Estuvimos en una cu\u00e1druple (4 personas en 2 camas de matrimonio en la misma habitaci\u00f3n), y para una estancia larga 5/7 noches es ideal para viajes de amigos o familias por su sal\u00f3n independiente al dormitorio. El s\u00e1l\u00f3n ten\u00eda un sofa-cama que no abrimos, ya que entonces la capacidad alcanza a 6 personas.\nPuntos positivos:\n- Habitaci\u00f3n amplia, limpia y sin ruidos.\n- Moqueta y mobiliario en buen estado general.\n- TV plana en habitaci\u00f3n y sal\u00f3n. (tuvimos tres problemas, uno con la caja fuerte, otro con las toallas y otro con la calefacci\u00f3n que solucionaron perfectamente en cuesti\u00f3n de minutos).\n- Delis, bares y restaurantes en las cercan\u00edas.\n- Buena comunicaci\u00f3n por trasporte p\u00fablico.\nPeque\u00f1os detalles negativos:\n- El ba\u00f1o algo peque\u00f1o para desplegar la parafernalia de hasta 6 personas.\n- A la cocina le faltaba un escurridor despu\u00e9s de limpiar los platos/vasos, aunque si hab\u00eda trapos de cocina.\n- A la habitaci\u00f3n le faltaba algo de luz, aunque hay l\u00e1mparas de pie auxiliares, m\u00e1s bien de lectura.\n- Colchones algo blandos, aunque a partir del segundo d\u00eda se acostumbra uno (ser\u00e1 que el de mi casa es muy duro).\n- Creo que hay dos tipos de cu\u00e1druples, unas con camas tama\u00f1o queen y otras king, en nuestro caso fueron queen y si duermen 2 personas grandes que no son pareja se nota.\nEn definitiva, y tras leer las cr\u00edticas de otros viajeros nos llevamos una buena impresi\u00f3n, ya que pens\u00e1bamos que iba a estar en peor estado, y no nos arrepentimos en absoluto de la elecci\u00f3n, llev\u00e1ndonos una agradable sorpresa.\nLa pr\u00f3xima vez elegiremos un hotel algo m\u00e1s al sur, para poder regresar caminando por la noche, siempre y cuando el presupuesto lo permita, ya que cuanto m\u00e1s c\u00e9ntrico m\u00e1s caro o bien inferior calidad al mismo precio...\nEn cualquier caso para volver al hotel y siendo 4 personas, un taxi no resulta caro y es la mejor opci\u00f3n.", "author": {"username": Meine Frau und ich waren vom 13.08.06 - 23.08.06 dort. Das Hotel liegt in der Upper Westside am Broadway. Die Umgebung ist weniger hektisch und weniger laut als in Midtown, trotzdem keineswegs ab vom Schuss. Das umliegende reichhaltige Angebot an Restaurants und Gesch\u00e4ften l\u00e4dt zum Spazierengehen ein. Die U-Bahn ist 3 Minuten zu Fuss entfernt (72.Stra\u00dfe). Hier sollte man sich eine \u00fcberall erh\u00e4ltliche Metrocard besorgen ( 7 Tage - 24 $ ). Zum nahen Central Park braucht man 10 Minuten zu Fuss und die n\u00e4chste Bank mit Geldautomat oder zum Eintausch von Travellerschecks ist schr\u00e4g gegen\u00fcber. Klasse ist auch der gegen\u00fcber liegende Fairway-Supermarkt, wo man alles n\u00f6tige bis um 1 Uhr nachts einkaufen kann. Das dort herrschende Chaos ist gew\u00f6hnungsbed\u00fcrftig, daher sollte man besser nicht zur Feierabendzeit einkaufen. Die Zimmer des Hotels - wir hatten ein normales Doppelzimmer - verf\u00fcgen \u00fcber eine K\u00fcchenecke mit Microwelle, Herd, K\u00fchlschrank (Gefriergefahr ! - Butter morgens rausnehmen ), Kaffeemaschine, Geschirr und Besteck f\u00fcr 4 Personen. F\u00fcr die Steckdosen ist ein Adapter erforderlich wenn man europ\u00e4ische Ger\u00e4te betreiben will ( Akkuladeger\u00e4t, Handykabel z. B. ). Die Einrichtung ist pr\u00fcschig, also eher konservativ-amerikanischer Geschmack eben, aber nicht h\u00e4sslich. Das Publikum ist angenehm, meist amerikanische Familien. Unser Zimmer lag im 5. Stock, der Strassenl\u00e4rm war nicht sonderlich laut. Die Zimmer werden t\u00e4glich wirklich gut gereinigt, das Bettzeug und die Handt\u00fccher auf Wunsch t\u00e4glich gewechselt. Das gesamte Hotel macht einen sehr sauberen und gepflegten Eindruck. Morgens gibts gratis eine Tageszeitung (USA today) vor jedes Hotelzimmer. Das Personal ist freundlich und nett. Es gibt einen Concierge zur Buchung von Tickets ( Musical, Circle Line, usw. ) oder zum Buchen eines Flughafentransfers. Dort kann man bis sp\u00e4t abends an jedem PC unbegrenzt und gratis surfen. Restaurants gibt es in der N\u00e4he des Hotels reichlich. Dabei laufen Dick und Doof-Filme und Oldies der 60er. Am besten drau\u00dfen sitzen. Klasse ist auch \"Emack & Bolios\" auf der Amsterdam Ave. Da gibts super Eis.
